<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.9-8
<SEQUENCE>7
<FILENAME>a2105105zex-10_98.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.9-8
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#03SEA1112_6">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_km1113_1_1"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.9.8  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="km1113_amendment_no._5_to_the_washing__ame03279"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_km1113_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NO. 5 TO THE<BR>  WASHINGTON MUTUAL,&nbsp;INC.<BR>  RETIREMENT SAVINGS AND INVESTMENT PLAN    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIS AMENDMENT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is made to the Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. Retirement Savings Investment Plan (the "Plan") by
Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company") on this 17<SUP>th</SUP> day of December&nbsp;2002. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>PROVISIONS FOR THE ECONOMIC GROWTH AND TAX RELIEF RECONCILIATION ACT OF 2001 ("EGTRRA")  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>PREAMBLE  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Adoption and Effective Date of Amendment.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This amendment of the plan is adopted to
reflect certain provisions of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 ("EGTRRA"). This amendment is intended as good faith compliance with the requirements of EGTRRA and is to be
construed in accordance with EGTRRA and guidance issued thereunder. Except as otherwise provided, this amendment shall be effective as of the first day of the first plan year beginning
January&nbsp;1, 2002. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Supersession of Inconsistent Provisions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This amendment shall supersede the
provisions of the plan to the extent those provisions are inconsistent with the provisions of this amendment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Multiple Use Test.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The multiple use test described in Treasury Regulation
Section&nbsp;1.401(m)-2 and Section&nbsp;4.5(b) of the Plan shall not apply for Plan Years beginning after December&nbsp;31, 2001. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Hardship Distributions Not Eligible For Rollover.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan is amended as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;8.2(b)(1)(D)
is amended to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(D)
After December&nbsp;31, 1998 and before January&nbsp;1, 2002, the portion of a Hardship Withdrawal attributable to elective deferral contributions. After December&nbsp;31, 2001, no portion
of a Hardship Withdrawal is eligible for rollover. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;9.2(f)
is amended to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Hardship Withdrawal Ineligible for Rollover.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective for Hardship Withdrawals distributed after December&nbsp;31, 1998
and before January&nbsp;1, 2002, the portion of a Hardship Withdrawal attributable to elective deferral contributions may not be part of an eligible rollover distribution. After December&nbsp;31,
2001, no portion of a Hardship Withdrawal is an eligible rollover distribution. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Distribution Upon Severance From Employment.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;8.1(c) is amended by
adding the following sentence at the end of that section: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Effective
for distributions after December&nbsp;31, 2001, termination of service will include severance from employment. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Modification of Top Heavy Rules.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following paragraphs are adopted: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Effective Date</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;section shall apply for purposes of determining whether the plan is a
top-heavy plan under Section&nbsp;416(g) of the Code for plan years beginning after December&nbsp;31, 2001, and whether the plan satisfies the minimum benefits requirements of
Section&nbsp;416(c) of the Code for such years. This section amends Article&nbsp;X of the plan. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="6",CHK=999450,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KM1113A.;7',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_km1113_1_2"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Determination of Top-Heavy Status</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Key Employee</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Key employee means any employee or former employee (including any
deceased employee) who at any time during the plan year that includes the determination date was an officer of the employer having annual Compensation greater than $130,000 (as adjusted under
Section&nbsp;416(i)(1) of the Code for plan years beginning after December&nbsp;31, 2002), a 5-percent owner of the employer, or a 1-percent owner of the employer having
annual Compensation of more than $150,000. For this purpose, annual Compensation means Compensation within the meaning of Section&nbsp;415(c)(3) of the Code. The determination of who is a key
employee will be made in accordance with Section&nbsp;416(i)(1) of the Code and the applicable regulations and other guidance of general applicability issued thereunder. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Determination of Present Values and Amounts</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Section&nbsp;2.2 shall apply
for purposes of determining the present values of accrued benefits and the amounts of account balances of employees as of the determination date. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2.1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Distributions during year ending on the determination date</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The present values of
accrued benefits and the amounts of account balances of an employee as of the determination date shall be increased by the distributions made with respect to the employee under the plan and any plan
aggregated with the plan under Section&nbsp;416(g)(2) of the Code during the 1-year period ending on the determination date. The preceding sentence shall also apply to distributions
under a terminated plan which, had it not been terminated, would have been aggregated with the plan under Section&nbsp;416(g)(2)(A)(i)&nbsp;of the Code. In the case of a distribution made for a
reason other than separation from service, death, or disability, this provision shall be applied by substituting "5-year period" for "1-year period." </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2.2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Employees not performing services during year ending on the determination
date.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The accrued benefits and accounts of any individual who has not performed services for the employer during the 1-year period ending on the
determination date shall not be taken into account. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Minimum benefits</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Matching contributions</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employer matching contributions shall be taken into account
for purposes of satisfying the minimum contribution requirements of Section&nbsp;416(c)(2) of the Code and the plan. The preceding sentence shall apply with respect to matching contributions under
the plan or, if the plan provides that the minimum contribution requirement shall be met in another plan, such other plan. Employer matching contributions that are used to satisfy the minimum
contribution requirements shall be treated as matching contributions for purposes of the actual contribution percentage test and other requirements of Section&nbsp;401(m) of the Code. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Rollovers Disregarded in Involuntary Cash-Outs.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;8.4 is
hereby amended by adding the following immediately preceding Section&nbsp;8.4(a): </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Effective
January&nbsp;1, 2002, for purposes of this Section&nbsp;8.4, a Participant's Vested Accrued Benefit shall not include the value of his Rollover Account. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Minimum Required Distributions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With respect to distributions under
Section&nbsp;8.1(d) of the Plan made for the calendar year beginning on January&nbsp;1, 2002, the Plan will apply the minimum distribution requirements of Section&nbsp;401(a)(9) of the Internal
Revenue Code in accordance with the regulations under Section&nbsp;401(a)(9) that were proposed on January&nbsp;17, 2001, notwithstanding any provision of the Plan to the contrary. This amendment
shall continue in effect until December&nbsp;31, 2002. Effective January&nbsp;1, 2003, the Plan will apply the minimum distribution requirements of </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="6",CHK=864152,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KM1113A.;7',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_km1113_1_3"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
Section&nbsp;401(a)(9) of the Code in accordance with the final regulations under Section&nbsp;401(a)(9) that were published in the Federal register on April&nbsp;17, 2002, notwithstanding any
provision of the Plan to the contrary. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Optional Forms of Distribution Eliminated.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any provisions in the Plan
to the contrary, effective for distributions commencing on or after November&nbsp;1, 2002, all optional forms of distribution are eliminated and the only form of distribution will be payment in lump
sum as set forth in Section&nbsp;8.2(a). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Direct Rollover of Plan Distributions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Effective Date.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This section shall apply to distributions made after
December&nbsp;31, 2001. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Modification of Definition of Eligible Retirement Plan.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of the direct
rollover provisions in section&nbsp;8.2(b) of the plan, an eligible retirement plan shall also mean an annuity contract described in section&nbsp;403(b) of the Code and an eligible plan under
section&nbsp;457(b) of the Code which is maintained by a state, political subdivision of a state, or any agency or instrumentality of a state or political subdivision of a state and which agrees to
separately account for amounts transferred into such plan from this plan. The definition of eligible retirement plan shall also apply in the case of a distribution to a surviving spouse, or to a
spouse or former spouse who is the alternate payee under a qualified domestic relation order, as defined in Section&nbsp;414(p) of the Code. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Modification of Definition of Eligible Rollover Distribution to Exclude Hardship
Distributions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of the direct rollover provisions in section&nbsp;8.2 of the plan, any amount that is distributed on account of
hardship shall not be an eligible rollover distribution and the distribute may not elect to have any portion of such a distribution paid directly to an eligible retirement plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Modification of Definition of Eligible Rollover Distribution to Include After-Tax Employee
Contributions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of the direct rollover provisions in section&nbsp;8.2 of the plan, a portion of a distribution shall not fail to be an eligible
rollover distribution merely because the portion consists of after-tax employee contributions which are not includible in gross income. However, such portion may be transferred only to an
individual retirement account or annuity described in Section&nbsp;408(a) or (b)&nbsp;of the Code, or to a qualified defined contribution plan described in Section&nbsp;401(a) or 403(a) of the
Code that agrees to separately account for amounts so transferred, including separately accounting for the portion of such distribution which is includible in gross income and the portion of such
distribution which is not so includible. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;9.2(d)
is amended by replacing the heading with the following: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Suspension of Salary Deferral Contributions  </I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;7.5(d)
is amended by adding the following sentence at the end of that section: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Effective
January&nbsp;1, 2002, a Participant or former Participant who has engaged in dishonesty in his relationship with the Company will forfeit all of his Accrued Benefit derived from Employer
Contributions upon termination only if he has not completed three years of Vesting Service. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13.&nbsp;&nbsp;A
new Section&nbsp;8.2(c)(iii)&nbsp;is added as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>8.2(c)(iii)
With respect to a Participant whose Accounts under the Plan include amounts transferred to the Plan in connection with the merger of the Long Beach Mortgage Company 401(k) Plan ("Long
Beach Plan"), and whose non-forfeitable balance in the Participant's Accounts </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="6",CHK=376274,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KM1113A.;7',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_km1113_1_4"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
exceeds $5,000, the Participant shall have the right to elect Life Annuities as an alternative to the normal form of distribution under the Plan solely with respect to benefits accrued as of
November&nbsp;30, 1998. Participant shall not be permitted to elect Life Annuities with respect to benefits accrued on or after December&nbsp;1, 1998. For purposes of this
Section&nbsp;8.2(c)(iii), "Life Annuities" shall have the meaning ascribed to that term in the Long Beach Plan. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;14.&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;9.7
is amended by adding the following to the end of that section: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Acquired
Participant Loans shall be governed by any Acquisition Loan Policy adopted by the Administration Committee and any related administrative guidelines to the extent that the policy and
guidelines are not inconsistent with the basic terms of the loans or any agreement between the Company and a merged company. For purposes of this Section&nbsp;9.7, the basic terms of loans shall
include principal, interest rate, term and payment. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>PROVISIONS RELATING TO FORMER EMPLOYEES OF DIME BANCORP,&nbsp;INC.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;15.&nbsp;&nbsp;Appendix&nbsp;A
is amended as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
following is added to the end of Section&nbsp;1: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>i.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Dime
Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
following sentence is added to the end of Section&nbsp;2: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Acquired
Participant Loans shall be subject to the provisions of any loan policy adopted by the Committee to the extent that any such policy is not inconsistent with the terms of the underlying
qualified plans. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;16.&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following sentence is added to the end of Section&nbsp;8.2(c): </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>This
Section&nbsp;8.2(c) shall not apply to any distribution occurring on or after November&nbsp;1, 2002. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;17.&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.41
of the RSIP is amended by a new paragraph&nbsp;(34), to read as set forth below: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(34)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Eligible
Employees who are credited with Service for service with Dime Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. or its affiliates may first enter the Plan on April&nbsp;1, 2002. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;18.&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
July&nbsp;1, 2002, Section&nbsp;7.5 is amended by the addition of new subparagraph (k), to read as set forth below: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(k)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each
Employee who has one or more accounts under the Plan attributable to such Employee's participation in a defined contribution plan maintained by Dime Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. shall be
vested in such account in accordance with the vesting provisions set forth in Article&nbsp;7 of the Retirement 401(k) Investment Plan of Dime Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc., as amended. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;19.&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;8.2(c)
is deleted and replaced by the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>8.2(c)
Effective only for distributions commencing on or before October&nbsp;31, 2002, the following special rules shall apply: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With
respect to a Participant whose Accounts under the Plan include amounts transferred to the Plan in connection with the merger of the Great Western
Employee Savings Incentive Plan with the Plan, and whose non-forfeitable balance in the Participant's Accounts exceeds $5,000, the Participant may elect that all or a part of his Accounts
be distributed in the form of approximately equal annual (or monthly or quarterly) installments (to be paid over a period not to exceed the lesser of the Participant's life expectancy or
15&nbsp;years). No Beneficiary shall be allowed to elect installment payments. The amount distributed on each installment date during a Plan Year shall equal the entire balance as of the prior Plan
Year end (excluding any portion of the Account paid as a lump sum) divided by the number of </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="6",CHK=125945,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KM1113B.;6',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_km1113_1_5"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
installments left in the payment period. Each installment shall be made, on a prorata basis, from each of the Investment Funds. Finally, a Participant who elects installments may elect a lump sum on
the remaining balance at any time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;With
respect to Participant whose Accounts under the Plan include amounts transferred to the Plan in connection with the merger of the Retirement 401(k) Investment Plan
of Dime Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc., and whose non-forfeitable balance in the Participant's Amounts exceeds $5,000</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>,</B></FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;&nbsp;if
requested by the Participant on a form provided by the Plan Administrator and filed with the Plan Administrator (or his or its designee) not later than the date
elected by the Participant for commencement of his benefits, in a lump sum distribution as of some other date following such termination, but not later than the latest date permitted under
Section&nbsp;8.2(c) (ii)(C), in which event the amount thereof shall be based on the value of his Account as of such other date; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B)&nbsp;&nbsp;if
requested by the Participant on a form provided by the Plan Administrator and filed with the Plan Administrator (or his or its designee) not later than the date
elected by the Participant for commencement of his benefits, in installments (monthly, quarterly, semiannual or annual, as elected by the Participant), over a fixed period, as of the first day of each
calendar month, commencing no later than the latest date permitted under Section&nbsp;8.2(c) (ii)(C), and the amounts thereof shall be based on the values of his Account as of such dates. Such fixed
period shall not exceed the life expectancy of the Participant or the joint life and last survivor expectancy of the Participant and his Beneficiary (if such Beneficiary is a natural person).
Installment payments shall be withdrawn from each of the Investment Funds in proportion to the relative values of the portions of the Account balance then invested in the respective Investment Funds,
unless withdrawal in some other proportion is requested by the Participant, and any portion of such vested interest which shall not have been so paid or delivered shall continue to be held for his
benefit, or for the benefit of the person or persons who may be or become entitled thereto; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C)&nbsp;&nbsp;For
purposes of the Section&nbsp;8.2(c)(ii), the latest date permitted shall be not later than the latest day that will permit the distribution to commence on or
before April&nbsp;1<SUP>st</SUP> of the calendar year following the later of (I)&nbsp;the calendar year in which the Participant attains age 70<SUP>1</SUP>/<SMALL>2</SMALL>, and (ii)&nbsp;the calendar
year in which the Participant retires. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=5,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="6",CHK=89561,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KM1113B.;6',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>

<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#03SEA1112_7">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ko1113_1_1"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.13.5  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ko1113_amendment_to_the_washington_mu__ame02540"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko1113_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT TO THE<BR>  WASHINGTON MUTUAL,&nbsp;INC.<BR>  CASH BALANCE PENSION PLAN    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIS AMENDMENT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is made to the Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. Cash Balance Pension Plan (the "Plan") by Washington
Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company") on this 19th day of February&nbsp;2002. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>RECITALS:  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the Company maintains the Plan for the benefit of its eligible employees; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company has agreed to acquire certain assets from HomeSide Lending,&nbsp;Inc. ("HomeSide"); and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company has agreed to provide the former employees of HomeSide who continue employment with the Company upon the termination
of the lease period with certain credits for eligibility, vesting and benefit service; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company desires to amend the Plan to provide for such credits; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company may amend the Plan at any time pursuant to Section&nbsp;12.1; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>NOW</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THEREFORE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, effective March&nbsp;1, 2002, the Plan is hereby amended as follows: </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.37(a)
is amended by the addition of a new paragraph&nbsp;(28), to read as set forth below: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(28)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
July&nbsp;1, 2002, Employees who were employed by HomeSide Lending,&nbsp;Inc. as of June&nbsp;30, 2002 and who are employed by the Company on July&nbsp;1, 2002
shall, after June&nbsp;30, 2002, be credited with Service for service performed with HomeSide Lending,&nbsp;Inc. or its affiliates and subsidiaries, provided that such Employees shall only be
credited with such service to the extent that it does not exceed the lesser of their actual service with HomeSide Lending,&nbsp;Inc. and four months. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.37
is amended by the addition of a new subsection (c)(iii)&nbsp;to read as set forth below: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;After
June&nbsp;30, 2002, Employees who are credited with Service pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.37(a)(28) shall have their service with HomeSide Lending,&nbsp;Inc. and its
affiliates credited as Years of Benefit Service for purposes of this Plan, provided that such Employees shall only be credited with such service to the extent that it does not exceed the lesser of
their actual service with HomeSide Lending,&nbsp;Inc. and four months. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<SEQUENCE>9
<FILENAME>a2105105zex-10_136.htm

<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#03SEA1112_8">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_kq1113_1_1"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.13.6  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kq1113_amendment_to_the_washington_mu__ame02540"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kq1113_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT TO THE<BR>  WASHINGTON MUTUAL,&nbsp;INC.<BR>  CASH BALANCE PENSION PLAN    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIS AMENDMENT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is made to the Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. Cash Balance Pension Plan (the "Plan") by Washington
Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company") on this 31st day of March&nbsp;2002. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>RECITALS:  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the Company maintains the Plan for the benefit of its eligible employees; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company has agreed merge with Dime Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. ("Dime"); and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company has agreed to provide the former employees of Dime and its affiliates and subsidiaries who continue employment with
the Company upon the closing of the Company's merger with Dime with certain credits for eligibility, vesting and benefit service; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company desires to amend the Plan to provide for such credits; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company may amend the Plan at any time pursuant to Section&nbsp;12.1; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>NOW</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THEREFORE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, effective April&nbsp;1, 2002, the Plan is hereby amended as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.30(a)
is amended by the addition of a new paragraph&nbsp;(29), to read as set forth below: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(29)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Eligible
Employees who were credited with Service for service with Dime Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. or its affiliates and subsidiaries may first enter the Plan on April&nbsp;1, 2002. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.37(a)
is amended by the addition of a new paragraph&nbsp;(27), to read as set forth below: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>(27)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employees
who were employed by Dime Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. as of the closing of the Company's merger with Dime Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. and who are employed by the Company upon such
closing shall, after March&nbsp;31, 2002, be credited with Service for service performed with Dime Bancorp Lending,&nbsp;Inc. or its affiliates and subsidiaries. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.37
is amended by the addition of a new subsection (c)&nbsp;to read as set forth below: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>March&nbsp;31,
2002, Employees who are credited with Service pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.37(a)(27) shall have their service with Dime
Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. and its affiliates and subsidiaries credited as Years of Benefit Service for purposes of this Plan. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="8",CHK=695256,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KQ1113A.;6',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>

</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.13-7
<SEQUENCE>10
<FILENAME>a2105105zex-10_137.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.13-7
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#03SEA1112_9">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ks1113_1_1"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.13.7  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ks1113_amendment_to_the_washington_mu__ame02540"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ks1113_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT TO THE<BR>  WASHINGTON MUTUAL,&nbsp;INC.<BR>  CASH BALANCE PENSION PLAN    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIS AMENDMENT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is made to the Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. Cash Balance Pension Plan (the "Plan") by Washington
Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company") on this 17th day of December&nbsp;2002. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Amendment of the Plan for EGTRRA Preamble.  </I></B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Adoption and Effective Date of Amendment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> This amendment of the plan is adopted to reflect certain provisions of the Economic Growth and
Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 (EGTRRA). This amendment is intended as good faith compliance with the requirements of EGTRRA and is to be construed in accordance with EGTRRA and guidance issued
thereunder. Except as otherwise provided, this amendment shall be effective as of the first day of the first plan year beginning after December&nbsp;31, 2001.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Supersession of Inconsistent Provisions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> This amendment shall supersede the provisions of the plan to the extent those provisions are
inconsistent with the provisions of this amendment. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Maximum Benefit Limitation  </I></B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Effective Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> This section shall be effective for limitation years ending after December&nbsp;31, 2001.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Effect on Participants.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Benefit increases resulting from the increase in the limitations of section&nbsp;415(b) of the Code will be
provided to all current and former participants (with benefits limited by section&nbsp;415(b)) who have an accrued benefit under the plan immediately prior to the effective date of this section
(other than an accrued benefit resulting from a benefit increase solely as a result of the increases in limitations under section&nbsp;415(b)).
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Definitions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Defined Benefit Dollar Limitation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The "defined benefit dollar limitation" is $160,000, as adjusted, effective January&nbsp;1 of each
year, under section&nbsp;415(d) of the Code in such manner as the Secretary shall prescribe, and payable in the form of a straight life annuity. A limitation as adjusted under section&nbsp;415(d)
will apply to limitation years ending with or within the calendar year for which the adjustment applies.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Maximum Permissible Benefit.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The "maximum permissible benefit" is the lesser of the defined benefit dollar limitation or the defined
benefit compensation limitation (both adjusted where required, as provided in (a)&nbsp;and, if applicable, in (b)&nbsp;or (c)&nbsp;below).
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
the participant has fewer than 10&nbsp;years of participation in the plan, the defined benefit dollar limitation shall be multiplied by a fraction, (i)&nbsp;the numerator of
which is the number of years (or part thereof) of participation in the plan and (ii)&nbsp;the denominator of which is 10. In the case of a participant who has fewer than 10&nbsp;years of service
with the employer, the defined benefit compensation limitation shall be multiplied by a fraction, (i)&nbsp;the numerator of which is the number of years (or part thereof) of service with the
employer and (ii)&nbsp;the denominator of which is 10.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
the benefit of a participant begins prior to age 62, the defined benefit dollar limitation applicable to the participant at such earlier age is an annual benefit payable in the
form of a straight life annuity beginning at the earlier age that is the </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="9",CHK=825317,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KS1113A.;8',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_ks1113_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>actuarial
equivalent of the defined benefit dollar limitation applicable to the participant at age 62 (adjusted under (a)&nbsp;above, if required). The defined benefit dollar limitation applicable
at an age prior
to age 62 is determined as the lesser of (i)&nbsp;the actuarial equivalent (at such age) of the defined benefit dollar limitation computed using the interest rate and mortality table (or other
tabular factor) specified in section&nbsp;2.3 of the plan and (ii)&nbsp;the actuarial equivalent (at such age) of the defined benefit dollar limitation computed using a 5&nbsp;percent interest
rate and the applicable mortality table as defined in section&nbsp;2.3(b) of the plan. Any decrease in the defined benefit dollar limitation determined in accordance with this paragraph&nbsp;(b)
shall not reflect a mortality decrement if benefits are not forfeited upon the death of the participant. If any benefits are forfeited upon death, the full mortality decrement is taken into account. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
the benefit of a participant begins after the participant attains age 65, the defined benefit dollar limitation applicable to the participant at the later age is the annual benefit
payable in the form of a straight life annuity beginning at the later age that is actuarially equivalent to the defined benefit dollar limitation applicable to the participant at age 65 (adjusted
under (a)&nbsp;above, if required). The actuarial equivalent of the defined benefit dollar limitation applicable at an age after age 65 is determined as (i)&nbsp;the lesser of the actuarial
equivalent (at such age) of the defined benefit dollar limitation computed using the interest rate and mortality table (or other tabular factor) specified in section&nbsp;2.3 of the plan and
(ii)&nbsp;the actuarial equivalent (at such age) of the defined benefit dollar limitation computed using a 5&nbsp;percent interest rate assumption and the applicable mortality table as defined in
section&nbsp;2.3(b) of the plan. For these purposes, mortality between age 65 and the age at which benefits commence shall be ignored. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Increase in Compensation Limit  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Increase in Limit.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The annual compensation of each participant taken into account in determining benefit accruals in any plan year
beginning after December&nbsp;31, 2001, shall not exceed $200,000. Annual compensation means compensation during the plan year or such other consecutive 12-month period over which
compensation is otherwise determined under the plan (the determination period). For purposes of determining benefit accruals in a plan year beginning after December&nbsp;31, 2001, compensation for
any prior determination period shall be limited as provided by the employer in the adoption agreement.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Cost-of-living Adjustment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The $200,000 limit on annual compensation in paragraph&nbsp;1 shall be adjusted for
cost-of-living increases in accordance with section&nbsp;401(a)(17)(B) of the Code. The cost-of-living adjustment in effect for a calendar year
applies to annual compensation for the determination period that begins with or within such calendar year.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Compensation and Statutory Compensation Limit for Prior Determination Periods.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> In determining benefit accruals in plan years beginning
after December&nbsp;31, 2001, the annual compensation limit in paragraph&nbsp;1 of this section for determination periods beginning before January&nbsp;1, 2002, shall be $150,000 for any
determination period beginning in 1996 or earlier; $160,000 for any determination period beginning in 1997, 1998, or 1999; and $170,000 for any determination period beginning in 2000 or 2001. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Modification of Top-Heavy Rules  </I></B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Effective Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> This section shall apply for purposes of determining whether the plan is a top-heavy plan under
section&nbsp;416(g) of the Code for plan years beginning after December&nbsp;31, </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="9",CHK=339654,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KS1113A.;8',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_ks1113_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2001,
and whether the plan satisfies the minimum benefits requirements of section&nbsp;416(c) of the Code for such years. This section amends Article&nbsp;8 of the plan. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Determination of top-heavy status.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Key Employee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Key employee means any employee or former employee (including any deceased employee) who at any time during the plan year
that includes the determination date was an officer of the employer having annual compensation greater than $130,000 (as adjusted under section&nbsp;416(i)(1) of the Code for plan years beginning
after December&nbsp;31, 2002), a 5-percent owner of the employer, or a 1-percent owner of the employer having annual compensation of more than $150,000. For this purpose,
annual compensation means compensation within the meaning of section&nbsp;415(c)(3) of the Code. The determination of who is a key employee will be made in accordance with section&nbsp;416(i)(1)
of the Code and the applicable regulations and other guidance of general applicability issued thereunder.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Determination of Present Values and Amounts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> This section&nbsp;2.2 shall apply for purposes of determining the present values of
accrued benefits and the amounts of account balances of employees as of the determination date. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="12%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2>2.2.1</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><FONT SIZE=2><I>Distributions During Year Ending on the Determination Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The present values of accrued benefits and the amounts of account balances of an employee as of the determination date shall be
increased by the distributions made with respect to the employee under the plan and any plan aggregated with the plan under section&nbsp;416(g)(2) of the Code during the 1-year period ending on the determination date. The preceding sentence shall
also apply to distributions under a terminated plan which, had it not been terminated, would have been aggregated with the plan under section&nbsp;416(g)(2)(A)(i)&nbsp;of the Code. In the case of a distribution made for a reason other than separation
from service, death, or disability, this provision shall be applied by substituting 5-year period for 1-year period.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="12%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.2.2</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"><BR><FONT SIZE=2><I>Employees not Performing Services during Year Ending on the Determination Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The accrued benefits and accounts of any individual who has not performed services for the employer during the
1-year period ending on the determination date shall not be taken into account.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Minimum Benefits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> For purposes of satisfying the minimum benefit requirements of section&nbsp;416(c)(1) of the Code and
the plan, in determining years of service with the employer, any service with the employer shall be disregarded to the extent that such service occurs during a plan year when the plan benefits (within
the meaning of section&nbsp;410(b) of the Code) no key employee or former key employee. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Direct Rollovers of Plan Distributions</I></B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Effective Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> This section shall apply to distributions made after December&nbsp;31, 2001.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Modification of Definition of Eligible Retirement Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> For purposes of the direct rollover provisions in section&nbsp;7.2 of the
plan, an eligible retirement plan shall also mean an annuity contract described in section&nbsp;403(b) of the Code and an eligible plan under section&nbsp;457(b) of the Code which is maintained by
a state, political subdivision of a state, or any agency or instrumentality of a state or political subdivision of a state and which agrees to separately account for amounts transferred into such plan
from this plan. The definition of eligible retirement plan shall also apply in the case of a distribution to a surviving spouse, or to a spouse or former spouse who is the alternate payee under a
qualified domestic relation order, as defined in section&nbsp;414(p) of the Code. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="9",CHK=1048168,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KS1113A.;8',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_ks1113_1_4"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Applicable Mortality Table</I></B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Effective Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> This section shall apply to distributions with annuity starting dates on or after December&nbsp;31, 2002.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Notwithstanding
any other plan provisions to the contrary, any reference in the plan to the Applicable Mortality Table shall be construed as a reference to the mortality table
prescribed in Rev. Rul. 2001- 62 for all purposes under the plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>For
any distribution with an annuity starting date on or after the effective date of this section and before the adoption date of this section, if application of the amendment as of
the annuity starting date would have caused a reduction in the amount of any distribution, such reduction is not reflected in any payment made before the adoption date of this section. However, the
amount of any such reduction that is required under &sect;415(b)(2)(B) must be reflected actuarially over any remaining payments to the participant. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="9",CHK=902013,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KS1113A.;8',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>

</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.13-8
<SEQUENCE>11
<FILENAME>a2105105zex-10_138.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.13-8
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#03SEA1112_10">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ku1113_1_1"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.13.8  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ku1113_amendment_to_the_washington_mu__ame02540"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ku1113_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT TO THE WASHINGTON MUTUAL,&nbsp;INC.<BR>  CASH BALANCE PENSION PLAN    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>PROVISIONS RELATING TO FORMER EMPLOYEES OF<BR>
DIME BANCORP,&nbsp;INC.  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. Cash Balance Pension Plan is amended by adding the following Appendix to the Plan: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>APPENDIX 3  </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Definitions.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Capitalized
terms in this Appendix&nbsp;3 are defined in Article&nbsp;2 of the Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. Cash Balance Pension Plan Amended and Restated Effective
October&nbsp;1, 1998, with the following exceptions: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Dime.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Dime Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc., The Dime Savings Bank of New York, FSB, and any other Affiliate (as
defined in Article&nbsp;1 of the Dime Plan). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Dime Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Retirement Plan of Dime Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. Amended and Restated Generally Effective as of
January&nbsp;1, 2000, including any amendments through March&nbsp;31, 2002. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NAMC Employees.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any individual of the North American Mortgage Company and its subsidiaries who was
ineligible to participate in the Dime Plan as defined in Article&nbsp;XIV of the Dime Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.4.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior Dime Active Participant.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An employee of Dime as of March&nbsp;31, 2002, who satisfied the
participation eligibility requirements of the Dime Plan as of March&nbsp;31, 2002. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.5.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior Dime Inactive Participant.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any person other that a Prior Dime Active Participant, who is entitled to
a benefit under the Dime Plan as of March&nbsp;31, 2002 that has not been distributed in full as of June&nbsp;30, 2002. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Background.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company merged with Dime as of January&nbsp;4, 2002. Employees of Dime as of January&nbsp;3, 2002 became employees of the Company as of January&nbsp;4, 2002. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2&nbsp;&nbsp;As
of March&nbsp;31, 2002, active participants of the Dime Plan ceased benefit accruals under the Dime Plan. As of April&nbsp;1, 2002, active participants of the
Dime Plan commenced benefit accruals under the Plan. As of July&nbsp;1, 2002, assets from the Dime Plan trust were transferred to the Plan's trust, and the Plan assumed liability for all benefits
accrued through March&nbsp;31, 2002 under the Dime Plan. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Applicability.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.1&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
any other provisions of the Plan to the contrary, the provisions of this Appendix&nbsp;3 shall apply to: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;Each
Eligible Employee who was a Prior Dime Active Participant or a Prior Dime Inactive Participant; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;Each
Eligible Employee who was included in a class of employees ineligible for participation under the Dime Plan, but also satisfies the eligibility requirements of the
Plan, including without limitation NAMC Employees. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="10",CHK=56269,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KU1113A.;6',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_ku1113_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Participation.</I></FONT></DD></DL>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1&nbsp;&nbsp;Each
person who is an Eligible Employee and who was a Prior Dime Active Participant shall become a Participant in the Plan effective April&nbsp;1, 2002. Each Prior
Dime Inactive Participant shall become a Participant in the Plan effective July&nbsp;1, 2002. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2&nbsp;&nbsp;Each
person who is an Eligible Employee who was included in a class of employees ineligible under the Dime Plan, including but not limited to NAMC Employees, but who
satisfies the eligibility requirements of the Plan as of March&nbsp;31, 2002, shall become a Participant in the Plan effective April&nbsp;1, 2002. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Recognition of Prior Service.</I></FONT></DD></DL>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.1&nbsp;&nbsp;For
each Participant who was a Prior Dime Active Participant, Years of Vesting Service as of March&nbsp;31, 2002 and Years of Benefit Service as of March&nbsp;31,
2002 shall each equal the Participant's Period of Service (as such term is defined in the Dime Plan) as of March&nbsp;31, 2002. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Service Accrual After March&nbsp;31, 2002.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.1&nbsp;&nbsp;Each
Participant who was a Prior Dime Active Participant shall commence to accrue additional Years of Benefit Service and Years of Vesting Service as of April&nbsp;1,
2002, based on the provisions of the Plan and the Participant's Hours of Service after January&nbsp;1, 2002. For the 2002 Plan Year a Participant may accrue more than one Year of Benefit Service and
more than one Year of Vesting Service. Each Participant who was in a class of employees ineligible under the Dime Plan, but who satisfies the eligibility requirements of the Plan as of
March&nbsp;31, 2002, shall commence to accrue additional Years of Benefit Service and Years of Vesting Service as of April&nbsp;1, 2002, based on the provisions of the Plan and the Participant's
Hours of Service after January&nbsp;1, 2002. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>7.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Benefit Amount.</I></FONT></DD></DL>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.1&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
July&nbsp;1, 2002, the benefit amount of each Participant who was a Prior Dime Active Participant shall be based on the Participant's Accrued Benefit, where
the Participant's Accrued Benefit as of any date after July&nbsp;1, 2002 shall equal the sum of the following amounts: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Accrued Benefit (as such term is defined in the Plan) based on Account Credits credited under the Plan after March&nbsp;31, 2002 to such date, based on
Compensation after March&nbsp;31, 2002 and Years of Benefit Service as of each Allocation Date after March&nbsp;31, 2002. This amount is the "CBPP Accrued Benefit Component'; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Accrued Benefit (as such term is defined in the Dime Plan) under the Dime Plan as of March&nbsp;31, 2002. This amount is the "Dime Accrued Benefit Component'. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.2&nbsp;&nbsp;Benefit
amounts based on the CBPP Accrued Benefit Component shall be calculated based on the provisions of the Plan, including actuarial equivalence factors. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.3&nbsp;&nbsp;Benefit
amounts based on the Dime Accrued Benefit Component shall be calculated based on the provisions of the Dime Plan including actuarial equivalence factors and
early retirement reduction factors. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.4&nbsp;&nbsp;The
lump sum value of the Dime Accrued Benefit Component shall be calculated as determined under the Dime Plan except the definition of actuarial equivalence (as such
term is defined in the Dime Plan) shall be replaced by the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
July&nbsp;1, 2002 to July&nbsp;31, 2002, actuarial equivalence shall be defined as actuarial equivalence (as such term is defined under the Dime Plan); </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
August&nbsp;1, 2002 to December&nbsp;31, 2003, actuarial equivalence shall be defined as the factor that produces the greatest lump sum value based on
actuarial equivalence (as such term is defined in the Dime Plan) and Actuarial Equivalent (as such term is defined in the Plan); </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="10",CHK=523464,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KU1113A.;6',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_ku1113_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
January&nbsp;1, 2004, actuarial equivalence shall be defined as Actuarial Equivalent (as such term is defined in the Plan). </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.5&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
July&nbsp;1, 2002, the benefit amount of each Prior Dime Inactive Participant shall equal the benefit amount under the Dime Plan, as of March&nbsp;31,
2002. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>8.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Vesting.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.1&nbsp;&nbsp;A
Participant shall vest in the CBPP Accrued Benefit Component according to the provisions of Article&nbsp;6 of the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.2&nbsp;&nbsp;A
Participant shall vest in the Dime Accrued Benefit Component according to Article&nbsp;IV of the Dime Plan, where Years of Vesting Service is substituted for Period
of Service (as such term is defined in the Dime Plan). </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>9.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Eligibility for Benefits.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.1&nbsp;&nbsp;A
Participant who is a Prior Dime Active Participant may elect to receive a benefit based on the CBPP Accrued Benefit Component and the Dime Accrued Benefit Component as
of the earlier of the applicable date of benefit commencement under the Plan and the applicable date of benefit commencement under the Dime Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.2&nbsp;&nbsp;Benefits
for a Participant who is a Prior Dime Inactive Participant will be paid according to the provisions of the Dime Plan. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>10.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Form of Benefit Payment.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.1&nbsp;A
Participant who is a Prior Dime Active Participant may elect any form of payment available under either Article&nbsp;7 of the Plan or Article&nbsp;V of the Dime
Plan for payment of both the Participant's CBPP Accrued Benefit Component and the Dime Accrued Benefit Component. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.2&nbsp;The
provisions of the Dime Plan, including actuarial equivalence factors (with regard to Section&nbsp;7.4 of this Appendix&nbsp;3), shall be used to calculate the
forms of benefit payment based on the Dime Accrued Benefit Component. The provisions of the Plan, including actuarial equivalence factors, shall be used to calculate the forms of benefit payment based
on the CBPP Accrued Benefit Component. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.3&nbsp;A
Participant who is a Prior Dime Inactive Participant may only elect benefit payment forms available under the Dime Plan for payment of the Participant's benefits. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>11.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Involuntary Cash-Out Payments.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.1&nbsp;The
provisions of the Plan regarding cash-out payments shall apply to the value of a Participant's benefit, including the value of the CBPP Accrued Benefit
Component and the value of the Dime Accrued Benefit Component at the time the Participant would be eligible to receive a distribution due to termination of Service. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>12.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Protection of Benefits.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.1&nbsp;All
benefits and forms of benefits provided under the Dime Plan that are required to be protected under section&nbsp;411(d)(6) of the Code shall be maintained under
the Plan with respect to benefits accrued under the Dime Plan prior to April&nbsp;1, 2002. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>13.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Applicability of Plan Provisions.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13.1&nbsp;Except
as otherwise specifically provided in this Appendix&nbsp;3, all provisions of the Plan shall apply to Participants that are described in Section&nbsp;4 of
this Appendix&nbsp;3. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="10",CHK=220640,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]KU1113A.;6',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<BR>

<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#03SEA1112_11">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
