<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lc1113_washington_mutual,_inc._wamu_shares"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lc1113_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WASHINGTON MUTUAL,&nbsp;INC.<BR>  WAMU SHARES    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 1. DEFINITIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Affiliate.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A "parent corporation," as defined in section&nbsp;424(e) of the Code, or "subsidiary
corporation," as defined in section&nbsp;424(f) of the Code, of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Board.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The board of directors of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Company.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. and its successors. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Code.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Committee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A committee to which the Board has delegated the authority to administer the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.6</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Date of Exercise.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The date that the Option exercise price is received by the Company or the person which the
Company has designated as its agent for administering the exercise of Options under the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.7</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Disability.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Eligibility for long-term disability benefits under a long-term
disability program sponsored by the Company or, in the case of an Employee not eligible for such a program because of insufficient hours of Employment, a condition which the Committee or its designee
determines is equivalent to a disability under such a program. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.8</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An individual employed by the Company or an Affiliate, except that the term "Employee" shall not
include any of the following officers: the Chairman of the Board, the President, the Chief Executive Officer, or any Executive Vice President, Senior Vice President or First Vice President of the
Company or an affiliate. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.9</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employed.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Performing services for compensation for the Company or an Affiliate as an Employee of the Company
or an Affiliate. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.10</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Performance of services for compensation for the Company or an Affiliate as an employee of the
Company or an Affiliate. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.11</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exchange Act.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.12</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair Market Value.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On any given date, the applicable description below: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;The
closing price of the Stock as traded on the National Association of Securities Dealers National Market System, as published in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>The New York
Times</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> or </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>The Wall Street Journal</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, on the business day immediately preceding the date as of which Fair Market Value is being
determined. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;If
the Stock is not traded as described in subparagraph (a), Fair Market Value shall be the value determined in good faith by the Committee or the Board. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.13</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Full-Time Employee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Employee who regularly is scheduled to work at least 40&nbsp;hours per
week. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.14</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Option.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The right that is granted hereunder to a Participant to purchase from the Company a stated number
of shares of Stock at the price set forth in an Agreement. An Option includes only options which are not qualified as "incentive stock options" within the meaning of section&nbsp;422 of the Code. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=3,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="12",CHK=160703,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]LC1113A.;4',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_lc1113_1_2"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.15</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Part-Time Employee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Employee other than a Full-Time Employee. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.16</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participant.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Employee of the Company or of an Affiliate who satisfies the requirements of
Article&nbsp;4 for an automatic grant. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.17</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. WAMU Shares program set forth herein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.18</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The common stock of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 2. PURPOSE OF PLAN  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The purpose of the Plan is to provide a performance incentive and to encourage stock ownership by employees of the Company and its Affiliates, and to align the
interests of such individuals with those of the Company, its Affiliates and its shareholders. It is intended that Participants may acquire or increase their proprietary interests in the Company and be
encouraged to remain in the employ of the Company or of its Affiliates. The proceeds received by the Company from the sale of Stock pursuant to this Plan may be used for general corporate purposes. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 3. ADMINISTRATION  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Administration of Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan shall be administered by the Committee. The Committee shall have complete
authority to (i)&nbsp;interpret all provisions of this Plan; (ii)&nbsp;determine in its sole discretion eligibility for participation in the Plan; (iii)&nbsp;adopt, amend, and rescind rules for
Plan administration; and (iv)&nbsp;make all determinations it deems advisable for the administration of this Plan. The express grant in the Plan of any specific power to the Committee shall not be
construed as limiting any power or authority of the Committee. Any decision made or action taken by the Committee to administer the Plan shall be final and conclusive. No member of the Committee shall
be liable for any act done in good faith with respect to this Plan or any Agreement or Option. The Company shall bear all expenses of Plan administration. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Discretionary Authority of Committee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except to the extent provided otherwise, the Committee shall have full
discretionary power, subject to, and within the limits of, the express provisions of the Plan: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;To
construe and interpret the Plan and Options granted hereunder, and to establish, amend, and revoke rules and regulations for administration. The Committee, in the
exercise of this power, may correct any defect or supply any omission, or reconcile any inconsistency in the Plan, or in any grant of an Option, in the manner and to the extent it shall deem necessary
or expedient to make the Plan fully effective. In exercising this power the Committee may retain counsel at the expense of the Company. All decisions and determinations by the Committee in exercising
this power shall be final and binding upon the Company and the Participants. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;To
accelerate the time at which an Option may be exercised. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the maximum exercise period provided in Article&nbsp;4 and Section&nbsp;6.3, the Committee may extend the exercise period of an Option if the
Committee determines that a Participant will be unable to exercise such Option within its stated exercise period on account of an unforeseeable hardship. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;To
authorize any person to execute on behalf of the Company any instrument required to effectuate the grant of an Option previously granted hereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;To
interpret the Plan and make any determinations that are necessary or desirable in the administration of the Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To
determine, in its sole discretion, eligibility for participation in the Plan in a manner consistent with the purposes of the Plan. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=4,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="12",CHK=667191,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]LC1113A.;4',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_lc1113_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;To
exercise such powers and to make all other determinations deemed necessary or expedient to promote the best interests of the Company with respect to the Plan. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 4. AUTOMATIC GRANTS TO EMPLOYEES  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective October&nbsp;1, 1997, the following Employees shall receive a stock option grant
described in Section&nbsp;4.2: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Full-Time Employees.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Employee who is a Full-Time Employee as of
September&nbsp;1, 1997; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Part-Time Employees.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Employee who is a Part-Time Employee as of
September&nbsp;1, 1997 and who worked at least one hour for the Company between January&nbsp;1, 1997 and August&nbsp;31, 1997, inclusive. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Grant.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective September&nbsp;1, 1997, any Employee described in Section&nbsp;4.1(a) shall be granted
an Option to purchase 100 shares of Stock. Effective September&nbsp;1, 1997, every Employee described in Section&nbsp;4.1(b) shall be granted an Option to purchase 50 shares of Stock. However, if
any Employee is on approved leave status as of September&nbsp;1, 1997, the grant of the Option which otherwise would be made hereunder shall not be effective until the date such Employee returns to
active Employment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vesting of Options.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Options granted under this Article&nbsp;4 shall be vested and fully exercisable as of
September&nbsp;1, 1999, providing such Option has not expired prior to the time of exercise. In addition, Options shall be vested and fully exercisable upon termination of Employment because of
Disability, death or retirement within the meaning of Sections 4.4(b), (c)&nbsp;and (d)&nbsp;respectively. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Expiration of Options.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Options granted to an Employee under this Article&nbsp;4 shall expire as of the
earliest to occur of the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;5:30&nbsp;p.m.
(Pacific Daylight Time) on September&nbsp;2, 2002; provided, however, that (i)&nbsp;if the Employee is on approved leave status as of
September&nbsp;2, 2002, then the Employee's Options shall expire at 5:30&nbsp;p.m. (Pacific Daylight Time) on the date on which the Employee returns to active Employment, and (ii)&nbsp;if the
Employee's Employment terminates for one of the reasons set forth in Section&nbsp;4.4(b) or 4.4(c) below, then the Employee's Options shall expire at the end of the twelve-month period specified in
Section&nbsp;4.4(b) or 4.4(c), as appropriate; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;Twelve
months after the termination of the Employee's Employment by reason of the Employee's Disability; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;Twelve
months after the termination of the Employee's Employment by reason of the death of the Employee; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;Twelve
months after the termination of the Employee's Employment by reason of the Employee's retirement from Employment with the Company or its Affiliates without
reemployment by the Company or one of its Affiliates and after attaining age 65; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;Thirty
days after the date of the termination of the Employee's Employment for any reason not described in Section&nbsp;4.4(b), (c)&nbsp;or (d), regardless of
whether the Employee returns to Employment subsequent to such termination. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No Agreements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No agreements shall be issued with respect to options issued under this Article&nbsp;4. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=5,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="12",CHK=895161,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]LC1113A.;4',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_lc1113_1_4"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 5. STOCK SUBJECT TO PLAN  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Source of Shares.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon the exercise of an Option, the Company shall deliver to the Participant authorized
but unissued Stock. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Maximum Number of Shares.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum aggregate number of shares of Stock that may be issued pursuant to the
exercise of Options is 2,200,000 shares of stock, subject to increases and adjustments as provided in Article&nbsp;8. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Forfeitures.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If any Option granted hereunder expires or terminates for any reason without having been
exercised in full, the unpurchased shares subject thereto shall be available for issuance under this Plan in connection with another Option. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 6. EXERCISE OF OPTIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exercise Price.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The exercise price of an Option shall be $59.875, which is 100% of the Fair Market Value of
a share of Stock on September&nbsp;1, 1997. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Right to Exercise.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Option granted under this Plan shall be exercisable as set forth in Article&nbsp;4. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Maximum Exercise Period.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as provided in Sections 3.2(c) and 4.4(a), no Option shall be exercisable
after the expiration of five years from the date it was granted. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Nontransferability.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any Option granted under this Plan shall not be transferable except by will or by the
laws of descent and distribution. Only the Participant to whom an Option is granted may exercise such Option, unless he is deceased. No right or interest of a Participant in any Option shall be liable
for, or subject to, any lien, obligation or liability of such Participant. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Minimum Exercise.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Option may be exercised in whole or in part, but the number of shares as to which the
Option is exercised must be a multiple of 25. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 7. METHOD OF EXERCISE  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exercise.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Option granted hereunder shall be deemed to have been exercised on the Date of Exercise.
Subject to the provisions of Articles 4, 6, 7, 8 and 9, an Option may be exercised in whole or in part at such times and in compliance with such requirements as the Committee shall determine. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless otherwise provided by the Agreement or by rules or procedures adopted by the Committee,
payment of the Option price shall be effected by payment in cash or by any other method approved by the Committee and communicated to Participants from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Federal Withholding Tax Requirements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon exercise of an Option by a Participant who is an employee of the
Company or an Affiliate, the Participant shall, upon notification of the amount due
and prior to or concurrently with the delivery of the certificates representing the shares, pay to the Company or its designee amounts necessary to satisfy applicable federal, state and local
withholding tax requirements or shall otherwise make arrangements satisfactory to the Company for such requirements. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Shareholder Rights.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No Participant shall have any rights as a stockholder with respect to shares subject to
his Option prior to the Date of Exercise of such Option. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 8. ADJUSTMENT UPON CORPORATE CHANGES  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjustments to Shares.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum number and kind of shares of stock with respect to which Options
hereunder may be granted and which are the subject of outstanding Options shall be </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=6,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="12",CHK=881002,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]LC1113A.;4',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_lc1113_1_5"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
adjusted by way of increase or decrease as the Committee determines (in its sole discretion) to be appropriate, in the event that: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Company or an Affiliate effects one or more stock dividends, stock splits, reverse stock splits, subdivisions, consolidations or other similar events; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Company or an Affiliate engages in a transaction to which section&nbsp;424 of the Code applies; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;there
occurs any other event which in the judgment of the Committee necessitates such action. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Provided,
however, that if an event described in paragraph&nbsp;(a) or (b)&nbsp;occurs, the Committee shall make adjustments to the limits specified in Section&nbsp;4.2 that are proportionate to
the modifications of the Stock that are on account of such corporate changes. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Substitution of Options on Merger or Acquisition.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee may grant Options in substitution for stock
awards, stock options, stock appreciation rights or similar awards held by an individual who becomes an employee of the Company or an Affiliate in connection with a transaction to which
section&nbsp;424(a) of the Code applies. The terms of such substituted Options shall be determined by the Committee in its sole discretion, subject only to the limitations of Articles 4, 5 and 6. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effect of Certain Transactions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon a merger, consolidation, acquisition of property or stock, separation,
reorganization or liquidation of the Company, as a result of which the shareholders of the Company receive cash, stock or other property in exchange for their shares of Stock, any Option granted
hereunder shall terminate, unless the Committee elects to convert all Options hereunder into options to purchase stock of an acquiring corporation. If the Committee so elects to convert the Options,
the amount and price of such converted options shall be determined by adjusting the amount and price of the Options granted hereunder in the same proportion as used for determining the number of
shares of stock of the acquiring corporation the holders of the Stock receive in such merger, consolidation, acquisition of property or stock, separation or reorganization, and the vesting schedule
set forth in the Agreement shall continue to apply to the converted options. In addition, the Committee, in its sole discretion, may grant Participants the right, immediately prior to any such merger,
consolidation, acquisition of property or stock, separation, reorganization or liquidation to exercise their Options in whole or in part whether or not the vesting requirements otherwise specified in
this Plan have been satisfied. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No Preemptive Rights.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The issuance by the Company of shares of stock of any class, or securities convertible
into shares of stock of any class, for cash or property, or for labor or services rendered, either upon direct sale or upon the exercise of rights or warrants to subscribe therefor, or upon conversion
of shares or obligations of the Company convertible into such shares or other securities, shall not affect, and no adjustment by reason thereof shall be made with respect to, outstanding Options. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fractional Shares.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Only whole shares of Stock may be acquired through the exercise of an Option. The Company
will return to the Participant any amount tendered in the exercise of an Option remaining after the maximum number of whole shares have been purchased. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 9. COMPLIANCE WITH LAW AND<BR>
APPROVAL OF REGULATORY BODIES  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No Option shall be exercisable, no Stock shall be issued, no certificates for shares of Stock shall
be delivered, and no payment shall be made under this Plan except in compliance with all federal and state laws and regulations (including, without limitation, withholding tax requirements), federal
and state securities laws and regulations and the rules of all national securities exchanges or </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=7,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="12",CHK=802995,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]LC1113A.;4',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_lc1113_1_6"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
self-regulatory organizations on which the Company's shares may be listed. The Company shall have the right to rely on an opinion of its counsel as to such compliance. Any certificate
issued to evidence shares of Stock for which an Option is exercised may bear such legends and statements as the Committee upon advice of counsel may deem advisable to assure compliance with federal
and state laws and regulations. No Option shall be exercisable, no Stock shall be issued, no certificate for shares shall be delivered and no payment shall be made under this Plan until the Company
has obtained such
consent or approval as the Committee may deem advisable from any regulatory bodies having jurisdiction over such matters. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Representations by Participants.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As a condition to the exercise of an Option, the Company may require a
Participant to represent and warrant at the time of any such exercise that the shares are being purchased only for investment and without any present intention to sell or distribute such shares, if,
in the opinion of counsel for the Company, such representation is required by any relevant provision of the laws referred to in Section&nbsp;9.1. At the option of the Company, a stop transfer order
against any shares of stock may be placed on the official stock books and records of the Company, and a legend indicating that the stock may not be pledged, sold or otherwise transferred unless an
opinion of counsel was provided (concurred in by counsel for the Company) and stating that such transfer is not in violation of any applicable law or regulation may be stamped on the stock certificate
in order to assure exemption from registration. The Committee may also require such other action or agreement by the Participants as may from time to time be necessary to comply with the federal and
state securities laws. This provision shall not obligate the Company or any Affiliate to undertake registration of options or stock hereunder. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 10. GENERAL PROVISIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effect on Employment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither the adoption of this Plan, its operation, nor any documents describing or
referring to this Plan (or any part thereof) shall confer upon any employee any right to continue in the employ of the Company or an Affiliate or in any way affect any right and power of the Company
or an Affiliate to terminate the employment of any employee at any time with or without assigning a reason therefor. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unfunded Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan, insofar as it provides for grants, shall be unfunded, and the Company shall not be
required to segregate any assets that may at any time be represented by grants under this Plan. Any liability of the Company to any person with respect to any grant under this Plan shall be based
solely upon contractual obligations that may be created hereunder. No such obligation of the Company shall be deemed to be secured by any pledge of, or other encumbrance on, any property of the
Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Rules of Construction.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Headings are given to the articles and sections of this Plan solely as a convenience
to facilitate reference. The masculine gender when used herein refers to both masculine and feminine. The reference to any statute, regulation or other provision of law shall be construed to refer to
any amendment to or successor of such provision of law. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Governing Law.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The laws of the State of Washington shall apply to all matters arising under this Plan, to
the extent that federal law does not apply. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Board may amend or terminate this Plan at any time; provided, however, an amendment that
would have a material adverse effect on the rights of a Participant under an outstanding Option is not valid with respect to such Option without the Participant's consent. Provided further that the
shareholders of the Company must approve any amendment: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.6</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective Date of Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Plan is effective as of September&nbsp;1, 1997. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
3</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
5.1</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="86%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
Source of Shares</FONT></TD>

<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>5.2</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="86%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>Maximum Number of Shares</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>5.3</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="86%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>Forfeitures</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD COLSPAN=4 VALIGN="TOP"><BR><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 6. EXERCISE OF OPTIONS</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
4</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
6.1</FONT></TD>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="13",CHK=83521,FOLIO='ii',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]LG1113A.;6',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="li1113_january_1999_wamu_shares"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_li1113_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>JANUARY 1999 WAMU SHARES    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 1. DEFINITIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Affiliate.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A "parent corporation," as defined in Section&nbsp;424(e) of the Code, or "subsidiary
corporation," as defined in Section&nbsp;424(f) of the Code, of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Board.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The board of directors of the Company. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Company.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. and its successors. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Code.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Committee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Compensation and Stock Option Committee of the Board, or such other committee to which the
Board has delegated the authority to administer the Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.6</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Date of Exercise.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The date that the Option exercise price is received by the Company or the person which the
Company has designated as its agent for administering the exercise of Options under the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.7</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Disability.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Eligibility for long-term disability benefits under a long-term
disability program sponsored by the Company or, in the case of an Employee not eligible for such a program because of insufficient
hours of Employment, a condition which the Committee or its designee determines is equivalent to a disability under such a program. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.8</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An individual Employed by the Company or an Affiliate and paid on the payroll of the Company or an
Affiliate, except that the term "Employee" shall not include any of the following officers: the Chairman of the Board, the President, the Chief Executive Officer, or any Executive Vice President,
Senior Vice President or First Vice President of the Company or an affiliate. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.9</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employed.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Performing services for compensation for the Company or an Affiliate as an Employee of the Company
or an Affiliate. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.10</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Performance of services for compensation for the Company or an Affiliate as an Employee of the
Company or an Affiliate. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.11</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exchange Act.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.12</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Full-Time Employee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Employee who regularly is scheduled to work at least 40&nbsp;hours per
week. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.13</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Option.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The right that is granted hereunder to a Participant to purchase from the Company a stated number
of shares of Stock at the price set forth in the Plan. An Option includes only options which are not qualified as "incentive stock options" within the meaning of Section&nbsp;422 of the Code. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.14</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Part-Time Employee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Employee other than a Full-Time Employee. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.15</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participant.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Employee of the Company or of an Affiliate who satisfies the requirements of
Article&nbsp;4 for an automatic grant. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.16</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;January&nbsp;1999 WAMU Shares program set forth herein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.17</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The common stock of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 2. PURPOSE OF PLAN  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The purpose of the Plan is to provide a performance incentive and to encourage stock ownership by employees of the Company and its Affiliates, and to align the
interests of such individuals with those of the Company, its Affiliates and its shareholders. It is intended that Participants may acquire or increase their proprietary interests in the Company and be
encouraged to remain in the employ of the </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=3,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="13",CHK=760210,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]LI1113A.;4',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_li1113_1_2"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
Company or of its Affiliates. The proceeds received by the Company from the sale of Stock pursuant to this Plan may be used for general corporate purposes. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 3. ADMINISTRATION  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Administration of Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan shall be administered by the Committee. The Committee shall have complete
authority to (i)&nbsp;interpret all provisions of this Plan; (ii)&nbsp;determine in its sole discretion eligibility for participation in the Plan; (iii)&nbsp;adopt, amend, and rescind rules for
Plan administration; and (iv)&nbsp;make all determinations it deems advisable for the administration of this Plan. The express grant in the Plan of any specific power to the Committee shall not be
construed as limiting any power or authority of the Committee. Any decision made or action taken by the Committee to administer the Plan shall be final and conclusive. No member of the Committee shall
be liable for any act done in good faith with respect to this Plan or any Option. The Company shall bear all expenses of Plan administration. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Discretionary Authority of Committee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except to the extent provided otherwise, the Committee shall have full
discretionary power, subject to, and within the limits of, the express provisions of the Plan: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;To
construe and interpret the Plan and Options granted hereunder, and to establish, amend, and revoke rules and regulations for administration. The Committee, in the
exercise of this power, may correct any defect or supply any omission, or reconcile any inconsistency in the Plan, or in any grant of an Option, in the manner and to the extent it shall deem necessary
or expedient to make the Plan fully effective. In exercising this power the Committee may retain counsel at the expense of the Company. All decisions and determinations by the Committee in exercising
this power shall be final and binding upon the Company and the Participants. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;To
accelerate the time at which an Option may be exercised. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the maximum exercise period provided in Article&nbsp;4 and Section&nbsp;6.3, the Committee may extend the exercise period of an Option if the
Committee determines that a Participant will be unable to exercise such Option within its stated exercise period on account of an unforeseeable hardship. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;To
authorize any person to execute on behalf of the Company any instrument required to effectuate the grant of an Option previously granted hereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;To
interpret the Plan and make any determinations that are necessary or desirable in the administration of the Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To
determine, in its sole discretion, eligibility for participation in the Plan in a manner consistent with the purposes of the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;To
exercise such powers and to make all other determinations deemed necessary or expedient to promote the best interests of the Company with respect to the Plan. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 4. AUTOMATIC GRANTS TO EMPLOYEES  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective January&nbsp;4, 1999, the following Employees shall receive a stock option grant
described in Section&nbsp;4.2: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Full-Time Employees.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Employee who is a Full-Time Employee as of January&nbsp;4,
1999; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Part-Time Employees.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Employee who is a Part-Time Employee as of January&nbsp;4,
1999, and who worked at least one hour for the Company between January&nbsp;1, 1998, and January&nbsp;4, 1999, inclusive. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=4,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="13",CHK=229637,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]LI1113A.;4',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_li1113_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Grant.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective January&nbsp;4, 1999, any Employee described in Section&nbsp;4.1(a) shall be granted an
Option to purchase 100 shares of Stock. Effective January&nbsp;4, 1999, every Employee described in Section&nbsp;4.1(b)
shall be granted an Option to purchase 50 shares of Stock. However, if any Employee is on approved leave status as of January&nbsp;4, 1999, the grant of the Option which otherwise would be made
hereunder shall not be effective until the date such Employee returns to active Employment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vesting of Options.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Options granted under this Article&nbsp;4 shall be vested and fully exercisable as of
January&nbsp;4, 2001, providing such Option has not expired prior to the time of exercise. In addition, Options shall be vested and fully exercisable upon termination of Employment because of
Disability, death or retirement within the meaning of Sections 4.4(b), (c)&nbsp;and (d)&nbsp;respectively. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Expiration of Options.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Options granted to an Employee under this Article&nbsp;4 shall expire as of the
earliest to occur of the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;5:30&nbsp;p.m.
(Pacific Daylight Time) on January&nbsp;5, 2004; provided, however, that (i)&nbsp;if the Employee is on approved leave status as of
January&nbsp;5, 2004, then the Employee's Options shall expire at 5:30&nbsp;p.m. (Pacific Daylight Time) on the date on which the Employee returns to active Employment, and (ii)&nbsp;if the
Employee's Employment terminates for one of the reasons set forth in Section&nbsp;4.4(b) or 4.4(c) below, then the Employee's Options shall expire at the end of the twelve-month period specified in
Section&nbsp;4.4(b) or 4.4(c), as appropriate; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;Twelve
months after the termination of the Employee's Employment by reason of the Employee's Disability; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;Twelve
months after the termination of the Employee's Employment by reason of the death of the Employee; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;Twelve
months after the termination of the Employee's Employment by reason of the Employee's retirement from Employment with the Company or its Affiliates without
reemployment by the Company or one of its Affiliates and after attaining age 65; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;Thirty
days after the date of the termination of the Employee's Employment for any reason not described in Section&nbsp;4.4(b), (c)&nbsp;or (d), regardless of
whether the Employee returns to Employment subsequent to such termination. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No Agreements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No agreements shall be issued with respect to options issued under this Article&nbsp;4. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.6</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional Grants.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Board may grant additional options by written authorization containing the date for
determining the eligible employees, the exercise price, and the dates on which options vest and expire. All other terms of this Plan shall apply to grants under this Section&nbsp;4.6. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 5. STOCK SUBJECT TO PLAN  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Source of Shares.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon the exercise of an Option, the Company shall deliver to the Participant authorized
but unissued Stock. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Maximum Number of Shares.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum aggregate number of shares of Stock that may be issued pursuant to the
exercise of Options is 3,300,000 shares of stock, subject to increases and adjustments as provided in Article&nbsp;8. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Forfeitures.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If any Option granted hereunder expires or terminates for any reason without having been
exercised in full, the unpurchased shares subject thereto shall be available for issuance under this Plan in connection with another Option. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=5,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="13",CHK=660772,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]LI1113A.;4',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_li1113_1_4"> </A>
<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 6. EXERCISE OF OPTIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exercise Price.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The exercise price of an Option shall be $32.875. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Right to Exercise.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Option granted under this Plan shall be exercisable as set forth in Article&nbsp;4. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Maximum Exercise Period.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as provided in Sections 3.2(c) and 4.4(a), no Option shall be exercisable
after the expiration of five years from the date it was granted. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Nontransferability.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any Option granted under this Plan shall not be transferable except by will or by the
laws of descent and distribution. Only the Participant to whom an Option is granted may exercise such Option, unless he is deceased. No right or interest of a Participant in any Option shall be liable
for, or subject to, any lien, obligation or liability of such Participant. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Minimum Exercise.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Option may be exercised in whole or in part, but the number of shares as to which the
Option is exercised must be a multiple of 25. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 7. METHOD OF EXERCISE  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exercise.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Option granted hereunder shall be deemed to have been exercised on the Date of Exercise.
Subject to the provisions of Articles 4, 6, 7, 8 and 9, an Option may be exercised in whole or in part at such times and in compliance with such requirements as the Committee shall determine. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless otherwise provided by the Plan or by rules or procedures adopted by the Committee, payment
of the Option price shall be effected by payment in cash or by any other method approved by the Committee and communicated to Participants from time to time. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Federal Withholding Tax Requirements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon exercise of an Option by a Participant who is an employee of the
Company or an Affiliate, the Participant shall, upon notification of the amount due and prior to or concurrently with the delivery of the certificates representing the shares, pay to the Company or
its designee amounts necessary to satisfy applicable federal, state and local withholding tax requirements or shall otherwise make arrangements satisfactory to the Company for such requirements. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Shareholder Rights.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No Participant shall have any rights as a stockholder with respect to shares subject to
his Option prior to the Date of Exercise of such Option. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 8. ADJUSTMENT UPON CORPORATE CHANGES  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjustments to Shares.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum number and kind of shares of stock with respect to which Options
hereunder may be granted and which are the subject of outstanding Options shall be adjusted
by way of increase or decrease as the Committee determines (in its sole discretion) to be appropriate, in the event that: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Company or an Affiliate effects one or more stock dividends, stock splits, reverse stock splits, subdivisions, consolidations or other similar events; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Company or an Affiliate engages in a transaction to which Section&nbsp;424 of the Code applies; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;there
occurs any other event which in the judgment of the Committee necessitates such action. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Provided,
however, that if an event described in paragraph&nbsp;(a) or (b)&nbsp;occurs, the Committee shall make adjustments to the limits specified in Section&nbsp;4.2 that are proportionate to
the modifications of the Stock that are on account of such corporate changes. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=6,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="13",CHK=61121,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]LI1113A.;4',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_li1113_1_5"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Substitution of Options on Merger or Acquisition.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee may grant Options in substitution for stock
awards, stock options, stock appreciation rights or similar awards held by an individual who becomes an employee of the Company or an Affiliate in connection with a transaction to which
Section&nbsp;424(a) of the Code applies. The terms of such substituted Options shall be determined by the Committee in its sole discretion, subject only to the limitations of Articles 4, 5 and 6. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effect of Certain Transactions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon a merger, consolidation, acquisition of property or stock, separation,
reorganization or liquidation of the Company, as a result of which the shareholders of the Company receive cash, stock or other property in exchange for their shares of Stock, any Option granted
hereunder shall terminate, unless the Committee elects to convert all Options hereunder into options to purchase stock of an acquiring corporation. If the Committee so elects to convert the Options,
the amount and price of such converted options shall be determined by adjusting the amount and price of the Options granted hereunder in the same proportion as used for determining the number of
shares of stock of the acquiring corporation the holders of the Stock receive in such merger, consolidation, acquisition of property or stock, separation or reorganization, and the vesting schedule
set forth in the Plan shall continue to apply to the converted options. In addition, the Committee, in its sole discretion, may grant Participants the right, immediately prior to any such merger,
consolidation, acquisition of property or stock, separation, reorganization or liquidation to exercise their Options in whole or in part whether or not the vesting requirements otherwise specified in
this Plan have been satisfied. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No Preemptive Rights.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The issuance by the Company of shares of stock of any class, or securities convertible
into shares of stock of any class, for cash or property, or for labor or services rendered, either upon direct sale or upon the exercise of rights or warrants to subscribe therefor, or upon conversion
of shares or obligations of the Company convertible into such shares or other securities, shall not affect, and no adjustment by reason thereof shall be made with respect to, outstanding Options. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fractional Shares.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Only whole shares of Stock may be acquired through the exercise of an Option. The Company
will return to the Participant any amount tendered in the exercise of an Option remaining after the maximum number of whole shares have been purchased. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 9. COMPLIANCE WITH LAW AND APPROVAL OF REGULATORY BODIES  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No Option shall be exercisable, no Stock shall be issued, no certificates for shares of Stock shall
be delivered, and no payment shall be made under this Plan except in compliance with all federal and state laws and regulations (including, without limitation, withholding tax requirements), federal
and state securities laws and regulations and the rules of all national securities exchanges or self-regulatory organizations on which the Company's shares may be listed. The Company shall
have the right to rely on an opinion of its counsel as to such compliance. Any certificate issued to evidence shares of Stock for which an Option is exercised may bear such legends and statements as
the Committee upon advice of counsel may deem advisable to assure compliance with federal and state laws and regulations. No Option shall be exercisable, no Stock shall be issued, no certificate for
shares shall be delivered and no payment shall be made under this Plan until the Company has obtained such consent or approval as the Committee may deem advisable from any regulatory bodies having
jurisdiction over such matters. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Representations by Participants.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As a condition to the exercise of an Option, the Company may require a
Participant to represent and warrant at the time of any such exercise that the shares are being purchased only for investment and without any present intention to sell or distribute such shares, if,
in the opinion of counsel for the Company, such representation is required by any relevant provision of the laws referred to in Section&nbsp;9.1. At the option of the Company, a stop transfer order
against any </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=7,EFW="2105105",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="13",CHK=381437,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK015:[03SEA3.03SEA1113]LI1113A.;4',USER='PHENTGE',CD='13-MAR-2003;02:35' -->
<A NAME="page_li1113_1_6"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
shares of stock may be placed on the official stock books and records of the Company, and a legend indicating that the stock may not be pledged, sold or otherwise transferred unless an opinion of
counsel was provided (concurred in by counsel for the Company) and stating that such transfer is not in violation of any applicable law or regulation may be stamped on the stock certificate in order
to assure exemption from registration. The Committee may also require such other action or agreement by the Participants as may from time to time be necessary to comply with the federal and state
securities laws. This provision shall not obligate the Company or any Affiliate to undertake registration of options or stock hereunder. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 10. GENERAL PROVISIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effect on Employment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither the adoption of this Plan, its operation, nor any documents describing or
referring to this Plan (or any part thereof) shall confer upon any employee any right to continue in the employ of the Company or an Affiliate or in any way affect any right and power of the Company
or an Affiliate to terminate the employment of any employee at any time with or without assigning a reason therefor. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unfunded Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan, insofar as it provides for grants, shall be unfunded, and the Company shall not be
required to segregate any assets that may at any time be represented by grants under this Plan. Any liability of the Company to any person with respect to any grant under this Plan shall be based
solely upon contractual obligations that may be created hereunder. No such obligation of the Company shall be deemed to be secured by any pledge of, or other encumbrance on, any property of the
Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Rules of Construction.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Headings are given to the articles and sections of this Plan solely as a convenience
to facilitate reference. The masculine gender when used herein refers to both masculine and feminine. The reference to any statute, regulation or other provision of law shall be construed to refer to
any amendment to or successor of such provision of law. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Governing Law.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The laws of the State of Washington shall apply to all matters arising under this Plan, to
the extent that federal law does not apply. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Board may amend or terminate this Plan at any time; provided, however, an amendment that
would have a material adverse effect on the rights of a Participant under an outstanding Option is not valid with respect to such Option without the Participant's consent. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.6</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective Date of Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Plan is effective as of January&nbsp;4, 1999. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></TD>

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>1.8</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="86%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>Employee</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
